column1: On [[26 September]] [[1947]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
column2: a letter]] to Jennifer Brookes-Smith'''.<ref group=note>Identified as "Jennifer [Paxman]" in the collection at the [[Marquette University]].</ref><ref name=CG>{{CG
column6: articlename=J.R.R. Tolkien Collection: Other Tolkien Writings, 1911-1976

column1: *'''Subject:'''  Signing the letter "Uncle Ronald", Tolkien offers advice about Oxford colleges, and discusses misprints in ''[[The Hobbit]]'', the development of [[runes]], and the various editions of ''The Hobbit''.<ref name=Marq/> Tolkien also expresses a dissatisfaction with [[Allen and Unwin
*'''Publication:''' A description of the letter appeared in ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide
column2: The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology]]''. Extracts from the letter were quoted in ''[[Christie's 20th Century Books and Manuscripts 2 December 2003]]''.
